alert.note: Alert for Charles City (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 12:47PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia, east central Virginia, south central Virginia and southeast Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Chesterfield and Henrico. In east central Virginia, Charles City, King William and New Kent. In south central Virginia, Prince George. In southeast Virginia, James City. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1247 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Kent, Charles City, Roxbury, Talleysville, Providence Forge, Adkins Store, Ruthville, Bottoms Bridge, Holdcroft, Tunstall, Rustic, Mountcastle, Sandybottom, Roaches Corner, Colonial Downs, New Kent Airport, Browns Corner, Wrights Corner, New Hope and Quinton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
